item.title: D sightseeing: crc32
item.description: Let's have a glance at a real although very short D program to discusssome of its features.

item.title: SSL/TLS Configuration Recommendations
item.description: How to configure SSL/TLS on your server in order to make it secure? Hereis the way to do it quick and cleanly.

item.title: Hacking the simplest database
item.description: Julia Evans proposed the simplest database, let's take it down! A casestudy of simple file manipulations in bash.

item.title: Fixing video noise with sox
item.description: How to use sox for something simple and practical: fixing the noise in ayoutube video.

item.title: Why we need authenticated cryptography
item.description: Simple demonstration of how an attacker could tamper with an encryptedmessage to his benefit without ever decrypting it in the absence ofmessage authentication.

item.title: Weaponizing Excel Webservice
item.description: Excel formula injections are common in programs generating XLS files, butotfen considered harmless. This discusses a new technique that greatlyimprove the Red Team situation.

item.title: Privilege Escalations
item.description: How to identify flawed resource management leading to privilegeescalation. Part of the Fast Security Source Code Review series.

item.title: Fast Security Source Code Review
item.description: Introduction to the main concepts behind a fast security review.Intended for developers as well as pentesters.

item.title: How secure is unpredictableSeed?
item.description: D's unpredictableSeed is sometimes used to compensate for the lack of aCSPRNG in the standard library. But how secure is that really?

item.title: Crypter writeup
item.description: "A file was encrypted. You have the encryption software and an encryptedfile. Decrypt that file." Detailed writeup using radare2.

item.title: Exploiting Gource
item.description: Improvised code review of the Gource git repository viewer. It is meantas a way to show how one can perform quick and targeted code reviews.

item.title: Let's build an Object System!
item.description: What makes an object system tick? What does it mean to be objectoriented? What are classes really?

item.title: Mail.local et TOCTTOU
item.description: Une explication détaillée d'exploitation de programme SUID root via uneTOCTTOU pour obtenir une élévation de privilège.

item.title: Comment who fonctionne-t-il ?
item.description: Strace est un outil puissant mais qui peut être difficile à manipuler.Nous voyons donc un cas concret en étudiant le fonctionnement de lacommande "who".

item.title: Puppy writeup
item.description: Quelqu'un sur irc a proposé hier un petit challenge de steganographie. Lavictime du jour ? Un chiot qui renferme, nous dit-on, des secrets.

item.title: Introduction à l'éditeur de texte ed
item.description: Ed est un éditeur puissant mais terriblement déconcertant au premierabord. Cet article présente les commandes essentielles et un peu pluspour bien débuter avec l'Éditeur.

item.title: Shell streams and redirections
item.description: Shell streams are the most powerful feature of bash. Knowing aboutredirections is a capital step toward an efficient use of command-line.
